intro: Urostachys williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces a distinctive capsule fruit containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
